info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud HCM - HCM Contacts
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud HCM â€” HCM Contacts module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Hcm Contacts

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

This header accepts a string value. The string is a semi-colon separated list of <parameter-name>=<parameter-value>. It is used to perform effective date range operations. The accepted parameters are RangeMode, RangeSpan, RangeStartDate, RangeEndDate, RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence. The parameter values are always strings. The possible values for RangeMode are SET_LOGICAL_START, SET_LOGICAL_END, END_DATE, SET_EFFECTIVE_START, SET_EFFECTIVE_END, REPLACE_CORRECTION, REPLACE_UPDATE, RECONCILE_CORRECTION, CORRECTION, RECONCILE_UPDATE, UPDATE, ZAP and DELETE_CHANGES. The possible values for RangeSpan are PHYSICAL_ROW_END_DATE and LOGICAL_ROW_END_DATE. The values for RangeStartDate and RangeEndDate have to be a string representation of a date in yyyy-MM-dd format. The value for RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence must be strings such that when parsed they yield positive integers.

variable.description: (Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the HCM Contacts resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of HCM Contacts. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the HCM Contacts collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of HCM Contacts to get the hash key.

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the Addresses resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Addresses. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Addresses collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Addresses to get the hash key.

response.name: No Content. This task does not return elements in the response body.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AddressId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the address record.
  • AddressType; string; Type of address. Valid values are defined in the commonLookupsLOV.
  • AddressTypeMeaning; string; Meaning of the contact's address type.
  • Building; string; Building information associated with the address.
  • Country; string; Country in which the address is located. Valid values are defined in the hcmCountriesLov.
  • CountryName; string; Name of the country in which the contact's address is located.
  • EffectiveEndDate; string; End date of the date-effective changes to the record.
  • EffectiveStartDate; string; Start date of the date-effective changes to the record.
  • FloorNumber; string; Floor number associated with the building.
  • Latitude; number; Distance between the equator and an address located to its north or south, expressed in degrees and minutes.
  • LongPostalCode; string; Long postal code of the primary mail address.
  • Longitude; number; Distance between the prime meridian and an address located to its east or west, expressed in degrees and minutes.
  • PersonAddrUsageId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the address usage record.
  • PostalCode; string; Postal code of the primary mail address.
  • PrimaryFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the address is the primary mailing address.
  • Provider; string; Company that has validated the address.
  • Region1; string; Primary region in which the address is located.
  • Region2; string; Secondary region within the primary region.
  • Region3; string; Additional secondary region within the primary region.
  • TownOrCity; string; Town or city in which the address is located.
  • ValidationStatusCode; string; Level of accuracy of an address, as determined by an address provider.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all the contact addresses that match the specified primary key criteria.
    Finder Variables
    • AddressId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact's address.
    • EffectiveEndDate; string; End date of the date-effective changes to the record.
    • EffectiveStartDate; string; Start date of the date-effective changes to the record.
    • PersonAddrUsageId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact's address usage record.
  • findByPersonAddrUsageId Finds all the contact addresses that match the address usage identifier specified.
    Finder Variables
    • PersonAddrUsageId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the address usage record.
    • SysEffectiveDate; object;
This query parameter is used to fetch resources which are effective dated as of the specified start date. The value of this query parameter is a string having a date in yyyy-MM-dd format

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:

  • CitizenshipMeaning; string; Name of the contact's citizenship legislation code.
  • CitizenshipStatus; string; Status of the contact citizenship. Valid values are defined in the commonLookupsLOV.
  • CitizenshipStatusMeaning; string; Meaning of the contact's citizenship status code.
  • ToDate; string; Date until when the contact citizenship is valid.

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • ContactRelationshipId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact relationship.
  • ContactType; string; Relationship between the worker and the contact.
  • ContactTypeMeaning; string; Meaning of the contact type code.
  • EffectiveEndDate; string; End date of the date-effective changes to the record.
  • EffectiveStartDate; string; Start date of the date-effective changes to the record.
  • EmergencyContactFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the contact is an emergency contact.
  • LegislationCode; string; Legislation code of the contact. Valid values are defined in the hcmCountriesLov.
  • LegislationName; string; Name of the contact's legislation.
  • PrimaryContactFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the contact is the primary contact.
  • RelatedPersonId; integer; Unique identifier of the worker to whom the contact is related.
  • RelatedPersonNumber; string; Person number of the worker to whom the contact is related.
  • StatutoryDependent; string; A persons contact is a statutory dependent validated against the lookup type ORA_PER_CONTACT_STATUTORY_DEP used by specific localization.
  • StatutoryDependentMeaning; string; Meaning of the contact's statutory dependent code.

This header accepts a string value. The string is a semi-colon separated list of <parameter-name>=<parameter-value>. It is used to perform effective date range operations. The accepted parameters are RangeMode, RangeSpan, RangeStartDate, RangeEndDate, RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence. The parameter values are always strings. The possible values for RangeMode are SET_LOGICAL_START, SET_LOGICAL_END, END_DATE, SET_EFFECTIVE_START, SET_EFFECTIVE_END, REPLACE_CORRECTION, REPLACE_UPDATE, RECONCILE_CORRECTION, CORRECTION, RECONCILE_UPDATE, UPDATE, ZAP and DELETE_CHANGES. The possible values for RangeSpan are PHYSICAL_ROW_END_DATE and LOGICAL_ROW_END_DATE. The values for RangeStartDate and RangeEndDate have to be a string representation of a date in yyyy-MM-dd format. The value for RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence must be strings such that when parsed they yield positive integers.

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • DriversLicenseId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the driver's license of a contact.
  • IssuingCountry; string; Country in which the contact's driver's license was issued. Valid values are defined in the hcmCountriesLov.
  • IssuingCountryName; string; Name of the country issuing the contact's license.
  • LicenseNumber; string; Driver's license number of the contact.
  • LicenseSuspendedFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the contact's driver's license is suspended.
  • LicenseType; string; Type of driver's license. Valid values are defined in the commonLookupsLOV.
  • LicenseTypeMeaning; string; Meaning of the contact's license type.
  • SuspendedFromDate; string; Start date of suspension period, if any.
  • SuspendedToDate; string; End date of suspension period, if any.
  • ToDate; string; End date of the contact's driver's license.

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • EmailAddress; string; Email address of the contact.
  • EmailAddressId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the email address of a contact.
  • EmailType; string; Type of email such as work, personal, and so on. Valid values are defined in the commonLookupsLOV.
  • EmailTypeMeaning; string; Meaning of the contact's email type.
  • PrimaryFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the email is the contact's primary email.
  • ToDate; string; Date until when the contact's email address is valid.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all the contact emails that match the specified primary key criteria.
    Finder Variables
    • EmailAddressId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact's email.

Instead, the client should query on the HCM Contacts collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of HCM Contacts to get the hash key.

(Required) The value of this parameter could be a hash of the key that is used to uniquely identify the resource item. The client should not generate the hash key value.  Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • EthnicityId; integer
  • __FLEX_Context; string; Context Value
  • __FLEX_Context_DisplayValue; string; Context Value

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

  • PrimaryKey

    • EthnicityId; integer;

variable.description: (Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the HCM Contacts resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of HCM Contacts. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the HCM Contacts collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of HCM Contacts to get the hash key.

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the Legislative Information resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Legislative Information. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Legislative Information collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Legislative Information to get the hash key.

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key--- PersonLegislativeId, EffectiveStartDate and EffectiveEndDate ---for the Person Legislative Developer Descriptive Flexfields resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Person Legislative Developer Descriptive Flexfields. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Person Legislative Developer Descriptive Flexfields collection resource with a filter on the primary key values in order to navigate to a specific instance of Person Legislative Developer Descriptive Flexfields.

For example: legislativeInfoDDF?q=PersonLegislativeId=<value1>;EffectiveStartDate=<value2>;EffectiveEndDate=<value3>

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey
    Finder Variables
    • EffectiveEndDate; string;
    • EffectiveStartDate; string;
    • PersonLegislativeId; integer;

This header accepts a string value. The string is a semi-colon separated list of <parameter-name>=<parameter-value>. It is used to perform effective date range operations. The accepted parameters are RangeMode, RangeSpan, RangeStartDate, RangeEndDate, RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence. The parameter values are always strings. The possible values for RangeMode are SET_LOGICAL_START, SET_LOGICAL_END, END_DATE, SET_EFFECTIVE_START, SET_EFFECTIVE_END, REPLACE_CORRECTION, REPLACE_UPDATE, RECONCILE_CORRECTION, CORRECTION, RECONCILE_UPDATE, UPDATE, ZAP and DELETE_CHANGES. The possible values for RangeSpan are PHYSICAL_ROW_END_DATE and LOGICAL_ROW_END_DATE. The values for RangeStartDate and RangeEndDate have to be a string representation of a date in yyyy-MM-dd format. The value for RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence must be strings such that when parsed they yield positive integers.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • EffectiveEndDate; string; End date of the date-effective changes to the record.
  • EffectiveStartDate; string; Start date of the date-effective changes to the record.
  • Gender; string; Gender of the contact. Valid values are defined in the commonLookupsLOV.
  • GenderMeaning; string; Meaning of the contact's gender code.
  • HighestEducationLevelMeaning; string; Meaning of the contact's highest level of education code.
  • LegislationCode; string; Legislation code of the contact. Valid values are defined in the hcmCountriesLov.
  • LegislationName; string; Name of the contact's legislation.
  • MaritalStatus; string; Marital status of the contact. Valid values are defined in the commonLookupsLOV.
  • MaritalStatusChangeDate; string; Date from when the marital status came into effect.
  • MaritalStatusMeaning; string; Meaning of the contact's marital status code.
  • PersonLegislativeId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact legislative information.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all the contact legislative information that match the specified primary key criteria.
    Finder Variables
    • EffectiveEndDate; string; End date of the date-effective changes to the record.
    • EffectiveStartDate; string; Start date of the date-effective changes to the record.
    • PersonLegislativeId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact's legislative information.
  • findByPersonLegislativeId Finds all the contact legislative information records that match the specified legislative identifier.
    Finder Variables
    • PersonLegislativeId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the legislative data.
    • SysEffectiveDate; object;
This query parameter is used to fetch resources which are effective dated as of the specified start date. The value of this query parameter is a string having a date in yyyy-MM-dd format

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

This header accepts a string value. The string is a semi-colon separated list of <parameter-name>=<parameter-value>. It is used to perform effective date range operations. The accepted parameters are RangeMode, RangeSpan, RangeStartDate, RangeEndDate, RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence. The parameter values are always strings. The possible values for RangeMode are SET_LOGICAL_START, SET_LOGICAL_END, END_DATE, SET_EFFECTIVE_START, SET_EFFECTIVE_END, REPLACE_CORRECTION, REPLACE_UPDATE, RECONCILE_CORRECTION, CORRECTION, RECONCILE_UPDATE, UPDATE, ZAP and DELETE_CHANGES. The possible values for RangeSpan are PHYSICAL_ROW_END_DATE and LOGICAL_ROW_END_DATE. The values for RangeStartDate and RangeEndDate have to be a string representation of a date in yyyy-MM-dd format. The value for RangeStartSequence and RangeEndSequence must be strings such that when parsed they yield positive integers.

The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Names collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Names to get the hash key.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all the contact names that match the specified primary key criteria.
    Finder Variables
    • EffectiveEndDate; string;
    • EffectiveStartDate; string; Start date of the date-effective changes to the record.
    • LocalEffectiveEndDate; string; End date of the date-effective changes to the local name record.
    • LocalEffectiveStartDate; string; Start date of the date-effective changes to the local name record.
    • LocalPersonNameId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact's local name.
    • PersonNameId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact's name.
  • findByPersonNameId Finds all the contact names that match the specified person name identifier.
    Finder Variables
    • PersonNameId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the person name.
    • SysEffectiveDate; object;

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the HCM Contacts collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of HCM Contacts to get the hash key.

(Required) The value of this parameter could be a hash of the key that is used to uniquely identify the resource item. The client should not generate the hash key value. query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • ExpirationDate; string; Expiration date of the contact's passport.
  • IssuingCountry; string; Country in which the contact's passport was issued. Valid values are defined in the hcmCountriesLov.
  • IssuingCountryName; string; Name of the country issuing the contact's passport.
  • PassportId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact's passport.
  • PassportNumber; string; Passport number of the contact.
  • PassportType; string; Type or category of the contact's passport. Valid values are defined in the commonLookupsLOV.
  • PassportTypeMeaning; string; Meaning of the contact's passport type.

    • PassportId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact's passport.

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AreaCode; string; Area code of the contact's phone number.
  • CountryCodeNumber; string; Country code of the contact's phone number. Valid values are defined in the hcmCountriesLov.
  • Extension; string; Extension number for the contact's phone.
  • LegislationCode; string; Legislation code of the contact's phone.
  • LegislationName; string; Name of the contact's legislation.
  • PhoneId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact's phone.
  • PhoneNumber; string; Contact's phone number for various phone types such as Work, Home, and so on.
  • PhoneType; string; Type of phone such as Work, Home, and so on. Valid values are defined in the commonLookupsLOV.
  • PhoneTypeMeaning; string; Meaning of the contact's phone type.
  • PrimaryFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the phone number is the primary phone of the contact.
  • ToDate; string; Date until when the contact's phone number is valid.
  • Validity; string; Time of day when a person can be reached at a specific phone number.
  • ValidityMeaning; string; Description of the phone validity. Valid values are defined in the commonLookupsLOV.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all the contact phones that match the specified primary key criteria.
    Finder Variables
    • PhoneId; integer; Surrogate identifier for the contact's phone.

For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.
